title: Instructional Design Based on Worked Examples and Self-Explanation for Programming Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of foundational programming concepts (e.g., variables, conditionals, loops)
context.additional_context: Strengthening social subject-linked programming problem-solving competencies for pre-service/in-service teachers

learning_goals: By analyzing three-step task examples, learners can solve simple programming problems (using conditional/loop statements) with 80% accuracy.
Following a guided question sheet, learners can self-explain code execution processes within 5 minutes.
Learners can write pseudocode for social studies scenarios (e.g., demographic analysis) with 90% completeness.

resources: QR code problem set for smartphones
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
